The shooting of two LA County Sheriff’s deputies is reprehensible. We must hold the assailant accountable to the fullest extent of the law, and strongly condemn the actions of those who blocked the entrance to the hospital and wished death upon the officers as they arrived.
RT @The_Citizen: Two mental health care-related bills introduced by U.S. Rep. John Katko are closer to final passage in the House of Repres…

The economic uncertainty and emotional toll of the current pandemic have only worsened the mental health crisis in our country.  We must continue our work to reduce stigma, increase access to treatment, and reach out to those who might be suffering.
RT @The_Citizen: U.S. Rep. John Katko will hold a virtual workshop on the economic impact payments that were part of a COVID-19 relief pack…

RT @GNYHA: The #COVID19 crisis has shown the necessity of addressing the nation’s worsening physician shortage. Congress must pass the Resi…

Today is International Overdose Awareness Day.  Central New York has long suffered from the impact of the opioid epidemic.  We must continue to raise awareness and enhance access to prevention and treatment for substance use disorders. #IOAD2020 #CutOutOverdoses

Meal delivery services like Meals on Wheels are more important than ever. That why I’m leading a bipartisan effort calling for $1.1 billion in COVID-19 relief funds for senior nutrition services and other programs offered through the Older Americans Act. 

https://t.co/7BHUI4oRfY

Yesterday, at @flcc_connects in Newark, I worked with the folks at Food Link Inc. to distribute food to over 300 households. It was great to help out and hear that many of the meals we provided were supplemented by the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. https://t.co/H9QFDPuPyV

The Presidential Election in Belarus was anything but legitimate. Presient Lukashenko must hold transparent and fair elections and immediately end the violent response to citizens peacefully protesting and journalists reporting on the election.

https://t.co/SeIvdABTUk

It’s time for the White House and Congressional Leaders in both parties to come back to the negotiating table. We need a COIVD-19 relief package that delivers additional support for working families, healthcare providers, small businesses, and state and local governments. https://t.co/xr9SFE7e8R

I’m pleased to announce @helio_health has received more than $400K in federal funds to expand its Join It, Live It, Be It program, which creates training opportunities for those seeking to work in behavioral health as a certified volunteer or counselor. https://t.co/1HzHvni7Lh

State officials have the ability to access these numbers, but have failed to make them public. Sadly, this is only further evidence of the state’s devastating approach to addressing COVID-19 in nursing homes.

New York is the only state in the country with major outbreaks that does not count nursing home residents who succumbed to the virus in a hospital towards the overall number of nursing home resident deaths.

The partisanship and posturing must end. With our communities still suffering from the devastating impacts of the pandemic, Congress needs to set partisan politics aside and work together to deliver relief. https://t.co/q9IgtAzlLf

To protect the health and safety of Central New York seniors, I’m leading an effort to urge Congressional Leaders to provide additional funding for local skilled nursing homes and assisted living facilities. https://t.co/BrdH7KnHBq

Congress should not leave Washington without addressing  unemployment benefits and providing additional relief to local hospitals, businesses, and families. We need to get this done. https://t.co/aXev0Ysoqr

With the economic uncertainty surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic, I’m working with Republicans and Democrats to ensure funding remains available for local infrastructure projects. https://t.co/EBuY8SukaP

To continue flattening the curve, we need buy in from young adults in our community. Avoiding large gatherings, wearing face coverings in public, and social distancing remain critical to combating this pandemic.
 
https://t.co/i8RuQxh6Sa

Thanks to everyone who participated in my Telephone Town Hall last night. We discussed the need for continued support for small businesses, working families, and hospitals & heard from folks on the dangerous impact of New York’s bail reform on local communities. https://t.co/3vtcLOQiR8
As Congress looks to consider an additional COVID-19 aid package this month,  I’m continuing to lead Republican efforts to deliver aid for state and local governments. https://t.co/42Lc3xPDx6

I am pleased to announce the @ProbSolveCaucus has endorsed my bill, the JOBS Act. In an effort to strengthen the economy and save local jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic, my bill takes steps to improve and expand the Employee Retention Tax Credit (ERTC). https://t.co/C3QS86vj8i

This is not over. The Administration must do a better job responding to the threat of coronavirus as we continue to see spikes across our country.
 
https://t.co/tIkBevpKqm

I’m honored to receive the @USChamber’s first-ever Jefferson-Hamilton Award for Bipartisanship. With CNY and our nation facing historic challenges, we must develop consensus on meaningful reforms, while working to deliver additional relief to those impacted by the pandemic. https://t.co/LsDlnkF2K0

I am pleased to announce that $2.5 million in CARES Act funds will be directed to @OnondagaCounty and the @Syracuse1848 to help individuals and families who are homeless amid the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/oFb2Vqwf9v

I called on the @USDA to expand access to nutrition assistance programs for working families who are struggling during the COVID-19 pandemic. As a result of this advocacy, I am pleased to announce that the USDA has approved NY’s request to operate the Pandemic EBT program. https://t.co/EsTDnY7MFQ

It was great to join @politico for a conversation on cybersecurity. We discussed my role as Ranking Member of the Subcommittee on Cybersecurity, the bipartisan bills I introduced, and the need to strengthen cyber protections amid the COVID-19 pandemic.  
 
https://t.co/DnIhNUwYwF

Our nation has the opportunity to grow and put thousands of workers like @GoIUPAT members back to work when the pandemic subsides. As we rebuild our economy, we should be investing in infrastructure projects that strengthen our roads, bridges, and support our medical facilities.

Tonight at 7pm on @NewsChannel9,
I will be joining Democrats and Republicans from NYS’s Congressional Delegation for a virtual bipartisan town hall on COVID-19. We will be taking questions from Central New Yorkers and viewers across the state and discussing the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/pG5hcN84nc

My bipartisan bill, the Resident Physician Shortage Act would add 15,000 resident spots to Medicare’s Graduate Medical Education Program— ensuring communities nationwide have access to care amid the COVID-19 pandemic, and strengthening our nation's healthcare system. https://t.co/L3yRe5Yub8

I would like to wish our Jewish friends and neighbors Chag Sameach as Passover begins this evening. While this year's celebration may look different, and be spent apart from loved ones, the spirit remains unchanged. I wish you health, peace, and joy today and throughout the year. https://t.co/cXUy2wPr5p

It was great meeting with a @wwp rep from Syracuse in my DC office. In Congress, I am working to honor the great sacrifices CNY veterans have made for our nation by helping veterans re-integrate into civilian life, and ensuring veterans get quality healthcare and support. https://t.co/IcOfbRVUzv

Proud to be featured by the @RiponSociety in the latest edition of the Ripon Forum. We talked about my recent efforts to improve access to mental healthcare in CNY and discussed my record of passing bipartisan legislation.

https://t.co/DIyw1ZGNkr

I was grateful to meet with local mental health advocates and clinicians from @AccessCNY at Provisions Bakery & Restaurant in Syracuse. We discussed the importance of ending the stigma associated with seeking mental healthcare and the need to improve access to care in CNY. https://t.co/4kdJoj1U7F

Robocalls continue to plague families and seniors across Central New York. This week, I was proud to vote in favor of the TRACED Act, bipartisan legislation that passed the House to combat the robocall epidemic. https://t.co/9Px0avHvQC

As co-chair of the bipartisan Mental Health Caucus, I am proud to introduce The Seeding Rural Resilience alongside @RepBrindisi and @RepAngieCraig. 

https://t.co/bS4ThJ2Zby

I participated in the ribbon cutting for the newly opened @DeptVetAffairs veterans outpatient clinic in Auburn. This new facility will provide access to primary care, diagnostic services, and behavioral healthcare options for more than 1,500 enrolled veterans. https://t.co/xFzS7DSL9q

I am proud to join the @afspnational in recognizing World Mental Health Day. If you or someone you know is having suicidal thoughts, please know that there are resources available to help, 24/7, at 800-273-TALK (8255). https://t.co/VOdYQMn3VZ
Glad to join Superintendent Kise of @SodusSchools in announcing $2.5 million in federal funding to address the shortage of mental health professionals in schools. https://t.co/kpp0IQsrfq

Excellent forum discussion @UpstateNews on the opioid epidemic in Central New York.  We must do more to prevent further opioid and heroin overdoses and ensure access to treatment for those struggling with addiction. https://t.co/1rEDHx3Gza
I joined @LibertyResourc1 for the grand opening of its Integrated Family Healthcare Center in Syracuse. I applaud Liberty Resources for improving access to mental healthcare. https://t.co/bktiidGYCs

Supporting efforts to improve our region’s mental healthcare has been among my top priorities in Congress, and I’ve consistently advocated for funding to ensure our community is able to improve access to these vital services – especially for children.

Standing alongside @Onondagacounty Executive Ryan McMahon, I announced $4 million in federal funding to support high-risk youth and expand mental health services in Onondaga County. https://t.co/G8R8nRdH4x

Under current law, women are not guaranteed reasonable accommodations to remain healthy and in the workforce during pregnancy. I spoke at a briefing on the bipartisan Pregnant Workers Fairness Act, a bill I introduced to change this outdated and unacceptable policy. https://t.co/wOL7SHlQBt

@SyracuseU opened the Barnes Center at The Arch on Friday. This new facility is set to become a hub for students and staff on campus with its wide offerings of recreational services as well as access to information on stress management and mental-health counseling. https://t.co/XwoWWT9EMq

@SyracuseU opened the Barnes Center at The Arch on Friday. This new facility is set to become a hub for students and staff on campus with its wide offerings of recreational services as well as access to information on stress management and mental-health counseling. https://t.co/PQi8NpSTrh

Productive discussion last night on the opioid crisis in Cayuga County. This epidemic requires efforts from all levels of government & I remain committed to advocating for increased funding for treatment, prevention & law enforcement on the federal level. https://t.co/qjmGCOq9Pn

Today, I visited Child Advocacy Professionals in Cayuga County to discuss pediatric mental healthcare. As the co-chair of the Congressional Mental Health Caucus, I am proud to stand alongside advocates working to provide support services for vulnerable children in our community. https://t.co/XvEiGiFGHW

The bill also establishes a task force specifically designed to protect hospitals, which are some of the most vulnerable targets. Too many in our community have fallen victim to robocall schemes and I am pleased to see the House take action against this harmful practice.
I visited Booker T. Washington Community Center in Auburn to hear about the recreational, educational, health and cultural programs offered to members of our community! https://t.co/1f5dfWj3KH

My visit to the Newark-Wayne Community Hospital was very productive and it was excellent speaking with these dedicated medical professionals.
